We know the flutist lives in house number 2.  The pianist has to be either in house 1 or 3 since they're one house away from the flutist.

Think about the clue about the tulips being to the left of the guitarist.  If the pianist was in house 1, there wouldn't be room for the tulips to be to the left of the guitarist. So, the pianist must be in house 3.

That means the tulips have to be in house 1! 


(C) 1
